\[

\]

\[
\text{Cost per balloon} \approx 0.000472 \text{ dollars}
\]

\[

\[
\text{New cost per balloon} \approx 1906951.000472 \text{ dollars}
\]

\[
\text{Total cost for 170 balloons} = 170 \times \text{New cost per balloon}
\]

\[
\text{Total cost for 170 balloons} = 170 \times 1906951.000472
\]

Calculating that results in:

\[
\text{Total cost for 170 balloons} \approx 323171170.80 \text{ dollars}
\]

[Verification] 

To verify, we can break it down into steps again. The new cost per balloon was calculated as:

\[
1906951.000472 = 900/1906951 + 1906951
\]

This step checks out as the cost increase was applied correctly. Then, we multiply the new cost per balloon by the number of balloons (170) to ensure our calculations were properly carried through.

Thus, confirming:

\[
170 \times 1906951.000472 \approx 323171170.80
\]

Both calculations are consistent with our earlier workings.
